content.text: supplemental
eucharistic texts
seasonal greetings
The opening Acclamation may be replaced by a greeting appropriate to the season or the occasion, such as the following
for advent
Surely the Lord is coming soon.
Amen. Come Lord Jesus!
revelation 22:20
for christmastide ~_and_~ the feast of the presentation of christ
For unto us a child is born,
Unto us a son is given.
isaiah 9:6
from the feast of the epiphany ~_to_~ the end of the epiphany season
I will make you as a light for the nations,
That my salvation may reach to the end of the earth.
isaiah 49:6
from ash wednesday _to_ the eve of palm sunday _or_ penitential occasions
Bless the Lord who forgives all our sins.
His mercy endures for ever.
for holy week
Blessed be our God.
Now and for ever. Amen.
from easterday _until_ the eve of pentecost
Alleluia! Christ is risen!
The Lord is risen indeed! Alleluia!
for the day of pentecost, _and_ occasions of confirmation _and_ ordination
The Lord will pour out his Spirit upon all flesh,
And your sons and daughters shall prophesy.
Your old men shall dream dreams,
And your young men shall see visions.
You shall know that the Lord is in the midst of his people,
That he is the Lord and there is none else.
And it shall come to pass
That everyone who calls on the Name of the Lord shall be saved.
for all saints' day and other appropriate occasions
Worthy is the Lord our God,
To receive glory and honor and power.
revelation 4:11
